settings.mat_text:
Produced by our manufacturer M-Corp in Poland. Learn more

Composition core fabric:

• 100% Tencel™ Lyocell (fibre origin: Jiangsu - Wuxi, China (Bluesign certified); country of manufacture: U.S.A.; Lenzig is FSC® and PEFC™ certified, Lenzing ID: 3197 6447)

Weight: 140 g/m²

• 100% Lyocell (country of manufacture: China; ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 certified, class II)

Weight: 150 g/m²

• 70% Lyocell

• 30% Linen

Country of manufacture: China; ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 certified, class II

Weight: 185 g/m²

• 100% Organic cotton (fibre origin: Turkey; country of manufacture: Turkey; GOTS certified)

Weight: 260 g/m²

• 100% Organic cotton (fibre origin: Turkey; country of manufacture: Portugal, GOTS certified) /henna/

Weight: 300 g/m² /henna/

• 95% Organic cotton

• 5% Elastane

Country of manufacture: Turkey; ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 class I certified (CU1000425GOTS-2020-00087120), GOTS certified (CU 100042)

Weight: 200 g/m² /dress/

Weight: 250 g/m² /tunic/

• 100% Nylon (PU finish, deadstock fabric, country of storage: Sweden)

Composition inner fabric:

• 100% Polyester (deadstock fabric)

• 67% Organic cotton (deadstock fabric)

• 33% Refibra™ (recycled lyocell and recycled cotton, deadstock fabric)

Trims and finishing:

• Threads: 100% recycled polyester (ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 class I certified, GRS certified; recyclable)

• Threads: 100% cotton (certified ÖKO-TEX Standard 100, class I; vegan; natural material, biodegradable)

• Interfacing: 100% recycled polyester (ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 class II certified; recyclable)

• Interfacing: 100% cotton (ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 class II certified; natural material, biodegradable)

• Corozo buttons: 100% tagua palm nut from Ecuador (natural, renewable material; biodegradable)

• Natural rubber: 65% organic cotton from Turkey, 35% natural rubber from plantations in Malaysia with no child labour (renewable resources; natural materials, biodegradable)

• Elastic cord: 40% organic cotton from Turkey, 60% natural rubber from plantations in Malaysia with no child labour (renewable resources; natural materials; biodegradable)

• Cord: 100% organic cotton from Turkey (renewable resources, natural materials, biodegradable)

• Naps tape: 100% chemically recycled polyester (recyclable)

• Metal main zipper YKK (chemically recycled polyester tape, brass chain, zinc slider, polyester inner cord) /inner layer & jacket/

• Plastic coil zipper YKK in the bottom section attachment (chemically recycled polyester tape, coil and inner cord; nylon slider, recycled zinc open parts)

• Plastic coil zippers YKK in the chest pockets and hood (chemically recycled polyester chain and tape; zinc slider, polyester inner cord)

• Care label: 100% organic cotton (ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 class I certified, raw cotton GOTS certified; renewable resources, natural materials, biodegradable)

• Brand label: 100% cotton yarn, 100% linen yarn, organic cotton (ÖKO-TEX Standard 100 class I certified, GOTS certified, renewable resources, natural materials, biodegradable)

Deadstock fabric

The term deadstock fabric refers to a fabric that wasn't sold or needed by a brand and is at risk of ending up in a landfill. It is often a result of an overestimation of a brand or an order cancelation. Deadstock fabrics are offered at the lower quantities, thanks to which small brands like ours are able to meet the minimum order quantities and avoid overproduction. It is important to call out the available stock fabrics, which is an overproduced fabric, when a factory knows that it's worth producing more, because it will eventually sell it. This is not what we support and we make sure we choose the responsible suppliers, like Rekotex, to choose the genuine deadstock fabrics for our products.

Tencel™

Tencel™ is the name of an Austrian brand owned by Lenzing AG and it's a trademarked name for the lyocell fibres. It is a cellulose fiber made by dissolving a sustainably sourced wood pulp and spinning it into yarns. It requires less energy and water for production than a conventional cotton and it maintains a closed loop process for the chemical treatment, where most of substances are recycled. Lenzig fibres are certified compostable and biodegradable in freshwater, marine and soil conditions by TÜV Austria, which means that they are biodegradable and compostable at the end of its useful cycle. It is soft, breathable and highly absorbent fabric with good resistance to wrinkles, making it a perfect choice for the travel capsule wardrobe.

Lyocell

Lyocell is a man-made, cellulose fibre created by dissolving wood pulp and spinning it into yarns. It requires less resources for production and it maintains a closed loop process for the chemical treatment. There is no difference between lyocell and Tencel®, the latter is simply a brand name, made by Lenzing AG in Austria. In fact, lyocell can be also known as Newcell and Excel - it is just made by other producers. Lyocell is biodegradable and compostable at the end of its useful cycle. It is strong, yet soft, breathable and highly absorbent fabric with good resistance to wrinkles, making it a perfect choice for the travel capsule wardrobe.

Modal

Modal is a man-made, bio-based fabric produced from beech tree cellulose. Since beech trees require less land and water to grow than cotton, modal is considered a more sustainable option than cotton. In comparison with other viscose fabrics, modal fibres are stronger, more durable, lighter and more breathable. Modal is also much more absorbent than cotton, slightly stretchy and silky-smooth in touch, which is why it will make a great addition to your luggage.

Refibra™

Refibra™ is an innovative fabric contributing to the circular economy in textiles, certainly one of our favourite. It contains up to 1/3 of the cotton scraps upcycled from the garment production, which are transformed into a cotton pulp and then combined with the sustainably sourced wood pulp to be transformed into a lyocell fibre. Refibra™ technology gives a second life to pre- and post- consumer sources, which would otherwise be sent to landfills or incinerated - by upcycling it into brand new cellulosic fibres. It has low cost and water requirements and it uses natural and renewable materials for production. It is breathable, lightweight, durable, anti-bacterial, water-absorbent, quick-drying, supporting the body's natural thermal regulation and remains odour-free for a much longer period than cotton, which makes it a perfect choice for the travel capsule wardrobe.
Refibra™ has a good resistance to wrinkling and pilling, which translates into garment's longevity, unless exposed directly to UV and sunlight. Refibra™ is fully biodegradable and compostable at the end of its useful cycle, being fully composed from the natural fibres.

Linen

Linen is a durable natural fibre derived from the flax plant, being one of the longest-produced textiles reaching as far back as to the Neolithic Era. It is stronger, thicker and slightly heavier than the typical cotton fibre and even though linen might feel rough in touch at the beginning, it softens throughout time and use. It's lightweight, highly absorbent, breathable, antibacterial, and dries faster than cotton, which makes it a perfect choice for the summer travel capsule wardrobe. It is resistant to peeling and not too stretchy. Linen is naturally prone to colour fading and creasing, which is why some garment containing linen might gain a vintage-look over time. Being a natural fibre, linen is one of the least environmentally damaging fabric, unless the retting process involves harmful chemicals, hence it is best to opt for the organic linen. Linen naturally biodegrades at the end of its useful cycle.

Elastane

Elastane is a lightweight, synthetic fibre usually used in stretchable clothing, made from polyurethane. It is not an environmentally friendly fibre, however the lifespan of the fabric, which contains the elastane can increase even up to two times. This translates into longevity and durability of your garment. If elastane is added in small quantities to a mono-material (i.e. 3% elastane and 98% of organic cotton), it can still be chemically recycled at the end of its useful cycle - as the research and development continues, this will hopefully improve over time (example: first biodegradable versions are appearing on the market too). Additionally, elastane's stretching properties help your garment to keep shape for longer, preventing sugging or bagging. On the negative side of the elastane fibres, they are created from non-renewable resources (petroleum) and if added in an excess to a mixed fabric, extremely difficult to recycle. Additionally, the problem of releasing the microfibers or microplastics to the soil and oceans remains, which is why we encourage you to use the microplastic filters in your washing machine like here or microplastic bags like here.

Organic cotton

Cotton represents nearly half the fibre used in the textile industry and only part of it is what’s called organic cotton. If sustainably and ethically produced, organic cotton is a great alternative to conventional cotton and it’s likely the most popular choice for an eco-textile. Contrary to conventional cotton, it uses far less water, no insecticides, reduces contamination of groundwater, poses no risk of cancer to workers, and encourages biodiversity. Globally, conventional cotton cultivation accounts for about 5% of global pesticide use even though it is cultivated only on about 2.5% of global arable land. From a circularity perspective, being a natural fibre, it has the added benefits of being 100% biodegradable, given there were no harmful chemicals used during the processing of the fibre. Certain certifications can help with the evaluation. The Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS), covers the processing, manufacturing, packaging, labelling, trading and distribution of textiles, ensuring that both environmental and social standards, such as safe and hygienic working conditions, no workplace discrimination and fair pay rates, are respected. This isn’t however the only certification focusing on organic cotton. There are also others like Organic Content Standard (OCS), Cotton made in Africa Organic, the EU Organic Standard, bioRe Sustainable Cotton or the Fairtrade Cotton. 

Recycled polyester

Recycled polyester is a better alternative to a virgin polyester. It is made of recycled plastic bottles or old clothes. Using recycled instead of virgin polyester reduces our dependency on fossil fuels, requires less energy, and produces fewer carbon emissions. By using plastic waste, it is diverted from oceans and landfills. The problem of releasing the microfibers and biodegradability remains the same though, which is why we encourage you to use the microplastic filters in your washing machine like here or microplastic bags like here.

settings.product_care_value:
For maximum longevity we recommend washing our product on hand-wash programme, with mild detergents and air-drying only. Otherwise:

• Air out instead of washing, minimise the washing cycles to save water and energy and prevent fabrics from fading

• Cold wash inside out with similar colours at maximum 30 degrees; close all zips and tie all cords before washing; for preventing the colour from fading we recommend colder wash at 20 degrees

• Use gentle detergent and fabric conditioner to ensure longevity of the garment; bleaching particles in conventional washing powder and liquid can make colours fade

• Do not tumble dry, air dry instead; reshape while damp, lay flat to dry

• Do not bleach, embrace all colours

• Do not dry clean

• Do not iron, wear rumpled proudly // Iron low heat at 110 degrees inside out // while the fabric is still slightly damp // or wear rumpled proudly

• Use a laundry bag and/or microplastic filters to stop microplastic pollution

• Avoid long direct light exposure to protect the colours; full sunlight will help keep whites bright, but will fade darker colours

• To keep the colours vibrant, we recommend soaking your laundry load in salt/vinegar water or occasionally re-dying the product with safe and natural dyes

• Never stop exploring, but explore responsibly ;)

The fabrics used in this product were decatised to minimise the shrinkage and deformations.

This product contains linen, which by nature is prone to colour fading and creases. Fading will be worse on the first wash, and then should reduce over time. As a result, this garment will gain a vintage look over time. To ensure vibrant colours, we recommend soaking the clothes before washing in cold water with salt/vinegar and ideally hand washing or washing at the hand-washing cycle in cold temperature with mild detergent.

This product contains recycled polyester / elastane, which releases microfibers to soil and oceans, which is why we encourage you to use the microplastic filters in your washing machine like here or microplastic bags like here.

settings.product_sustainability_value:
Circular design

This product was designed following circular principles, aiming at its full recyclability and/or biodegradability at the end of its useful cycle - including such tiny details like trims or threads (you can read about them in the 'Materials & Manufacturer" section). Circular products are designed, sourced and produced with the goal to stay in the loop for as long as possible and when their end of lifecycle is over, to be returned safely back to the environment (either through recycling or biodegrading). By choosing a circular product, you cast your vote for the responsible production, where resource scarcity is taken seriously and where brands take responsibility for the product's longevity and end of lifecycle. This way you support new business models, which ensure that the clothes you are wearing are safe and made from renewable materials and when their journey is over they can become the new resources and be relooped back to the system.

Sustainable

This product is produced in a sustainable way, which means that it is created in a way that can be sustained for this and future generations, while protecting both Planet and People producing it. It is produced by a Fair Wear Foundation Leader Stanley/Stella which, by using organic cotton, helps sustain natural resources and improve the livelihood of people involved in its production. For more information on our supplier read on.

Produced from certified materials

This product was designed with a great attention to its components, which in majority are certified: you can read more about each component in the 'Materials & Manufacturer' section. While we are aiming at being certified ourselves, we rely on our suppliers and pay great attention to the materials we choose, to make sure they are healthy for you and the Planet. Even though we can't market ourselves as certified company, we want to choose the best and certified materials. We just find it the right thing to do and we want to be as transparent as we possibly can.

Organic materials

This product is made from organic fabrics, which means that the fibre is grown without toxic substances, fertilizers and polluting pesticides. This translates into higher quality of the product, healthier soils, protecting local habitats, increasing biodiversity and improving the livelihood of people involved in growing them. They are better for you, the People and the Planet.

Natural materials

Natural fibres are not only better for your skin and wallet thanks to their superb characteristics, but most importantly they all come from renewable resources. Natural materials strengthen the circular system through biodegrading at the end of their useful cycle and since they easily decompose in the soil or water, they can safely return to nature where they came from. If the product is truly and 101% made from natural materials (including even threads and labels), it doesn't pollute soil nor oceans with the microplastic and while biodegrading it doesn't leech toxins into environment (unless such were used in the dying process). The drawback of using the natural fibres is that their colours fade faster and are more prone to discoloration, as well as they aren't as wrinkle resistant as the synthetic fibres. Luckily you can re-dye your clothes really easily and every Black-Friday we help you with that.

Recycled materials

This product contains recycled fibres, which supports the circular economy model, where all raw materials are kept in use as long as possible. Recycling means conserving natural resources and reducing waste, while preventing it from the landfills and incinerators.

Contains Deadstock fabric

This product contains deadstock fabrics, which means that it helps overcome the overproduction problems and prevent the materials from being incinerated or sent to landfills (fabric waste). By choosing what was already produced, you contribute to producing from materials already circulating in the loop and avoid producing new fibres (and alarmingly there are still many new fabrics turning into a deadstock). Deadstock fabric promote waste reduction and mindful consumption, unless they are sourced from brands which intentionally overproduce to take advantage of the deadstock market.

Easy to repair

This product was designed with longevity and repairability in mind. Thanks to spare trims built into the care label and spare threads threaded into the inner seams, it is easier to replace the damaged parts with the matching colours. Take a look at our repair kits to find the replacement pieces accordingly and learn how to fix your clothes yourself. If the colour on your favourite item faded in time, stay tuned for our Black Fri-dye action. Designing clothes that are easy to repair is part of our circular model, helping us increase the longevity of the product.

Modular/Reversible - less is more

Less is more. This product is modular/reversible by its design, which means that you can easily transform its look and functionality. By choosing the products which are modular/reversible, you gain more looks with a single product, and therefore you minimise your wardrobe and pack less without giving up your style. This supports our circular capsule wardrobe vision, where less clothes mean less production and less fashion waste. Choose responsibly and pack smart.

End of Lifecycle - biodegradable/compostable

This product is fully biodegradable and recyclable at the end of its useful cycle and can be recycled through a chemical cycle. For biodegrading, decompose your product from non-biodegradable elements (if there are such), shred them to accelerate the process and bury them in an active soil. Allow few weeks (depending on the garment) for the process to begin. For returning it to recycle, simply decompose the garment into individual pieces and return to recycle. Check our 'Let's Reloop' tab for more information.

End of Lifecycle - biodegradable/recyclable

This product is fully biodegradable and recyclable at the end of its useful cycle and can be recycled through a chemical/mechanical cycle. For biodegrading, cut off the harmful or synthetic trims and bury the product in an active soil. For returning it to recycle, simply decompose the garment into individual pieces. Check our 'Let's Reloop' tab for more information.

End of Lifecycle - recyclable

This product is fully recyclable at the end of its useful cycle and can be recycled through a chemical cycle. For returning it to recycle, simply decompose the garment into individual pieces. Check our 'Let's Reloop' tab for more information.

settings.shipping_returns_value:
Pre-ordering

This product is currently available for PRE-ORDERS only.

Pre-ordering means ordering upfront the products, that weren't yet produced and that you will receive only few weeks later. This model is beneficial for you, us and the environment. Here's why:

By introducing pre-orders, we want to eliminate the fashion overproduction problem and therefore waste (for both garment and materials). Knowing the demand ahead of time, allows us to adjust the supply and produce responsibly with the quantities calculated upfront, which is a sustainable alternative to a mass-production. Being a small circular brand, it also helps us to manage our investment better and reduce the risk of being left with unsold items.

What's in it for you? Not only you receive a discount in return for your patience, but most importantly it's a great practice of conscious shopping. Longer waiting time minimises the chances of compulsive buying and encourages thoughtful decision-making process. By choosing to pre-order, you support the sustainable sale models and contribute to a positive change in the fashion industry. Plus, you are the first one to get the new arrival and help us shape the way our products are designed :)

For more information on our pre-orders, visit our Shipping & Returns page or feel free to contact us with any questions. Otherwise, our standard Shipping and Returns Terms and Conditions will apply to pre-orders once ready:

Shipping Costs

We offer free shipping for orders above 150 EUR. For orders below we will add a shipping cost of 4,95 EUR in Germany or accordingly cost from our price list per each European country. For detailed information read our Shipping & Returns page.

Delivery Times

Our delivery times are 2-4 days within Germany and 3-7 days within Europe after registering the product on our stock-list. All orders are processed at our main hub in Füssen, Germany.

30 Days Return Policy

You have the right to cancel and return your order within 14 days, for any reason and without a justification. We want you to be happy with your purchase and make sure your products will be with you for a long time ahead, therefore we have an extended 30 days return policy. In case of pre-ordered items, the 30-days period starts when the item is registered for the first time in our stock-list; you can find this information under the product description. Go to our Shipping & Returns page to read more on our shipping and return details.

This product will be available soon for preorders. It is part of our first circular capsule collection created for travellers who want to travel light and worry free. Stay tuned and #LetsReloop.

Our digital model, Wanda, is 166 cm (5’ 5“) tall and is wearing size S ... Show more here. She has 89.5 cm (35’’) in chest, 73.6 cm under bust (29’’), 68.5 cm (27’’) in waist, 85 cm in high hips (33.5’’) and 97 cm (38’’) in low hips. She usually wears size S, as that's how we designed her :)

settings.title: IN A NUTSHELL
settings.content:
This product was designed for travellers, by travellers; per destination - not transient fashion trends. The fabrics and trims were carefully selected to give you maximum comfort in hot destinations and become part of the summer travel capsule wardrobe.

This product is designed following circularity principles and can be biodegraded or chemically recycled at the end of its useful cycle. When your journey with this product is over, return it to recycle or biodegrade.

settings.subheading: HOW ARE WE DESIGNING OUR CLOTHES
settings.title: CIRCULAR CAPSULE WARDROBE
settings.content:
Less is more. By choosing less, well-matching, quality items, we can make more thoughtful purchase decisions and avoid compulsive buying, just to regret it later. Ever heard of a problem "I have nothing to wear"?

Here at Reloop Wear, we design per destination, not transient fashion trends. Our collections are timeless, versatile and created for travellers - by travellers, just like you. Building your circular travel capsule wardrobe isn't such a complicated thing.

Care to join us on the journey?

settings.title: OUR CIRCULAR ROADMAP
settings.content:
We strive for sustainability and 100% circularity of every single product we share with you, but we're definitely not there YET.

Check our Circular Roadmap to learn how we are achieving it and read our Transparency Report to see where we are at.

If you have any questions about our products, we encourage you to reach out. We will be happy to share all information with you!

settings.title: ABOUT OUR SUPPLIERS
settings.content:
We believe in transparency and we want to share all information you need from us to make a fully conscious decision about your purchase.

This item was produced by our manufacturer M-Corp in Poland.

Learn more:

settings.content_left: Caring for the Planet, by creating travel capsule wardrobe for conscious travellers, designed with circularity at every step of the journey. Less is more. #LetsReloop
settings.content: You choose what you get in your inbox. We make sure it is providing value and inspiration to your travel capsule wardrobe.
